basics.name: Jason Manshadi
basics.label: Developer
basics.summary: I am an developer from C++ and Java origins, now focusing on adding web development to my resume with personal projects listed below.

profiles.username: This Resume is built from this Github Repo

work.summary: Responded to internal IT tickets raised and diagnosed issues regarding software and hardware issues with virtual and physical machines.
highlights: Created a process that automated the installation of necessary programs, SDKs and repositories using Ansible which allowed the developers to spin up new virtual machines with minimal effort.

Created a python script to allow indirect use of Ansible script for easier set-up of VMs from the command line which removed dependence of Ansible knowledge and Jenkins server as well as making it easier to run batch jobs.
Updated existing python script to catch and report incorrect host entries on internal database to ensure that failing hosts could be identified in event of outages effecting production systems.
Gained experience with Mockito and PowerMockito while writing Java Unit Tests to increase code coverage to over 80%.
Participated in bi-weekly regression tests of ORCA’s “Import Data Connection” component to detect any final bugs that existed before ORCA was demoed for partners and customers.

work.position: Research Assistant for LUCI Fatigue Study
work.summary: Ran participants through a sleep study designed to monitor the effects of fatigue on volunteers with a series of recurring steps tasks.
highlights: Ran each participant during a graveyard shift and ensured that all tasks were done correctly despite the late hour.
Created a PowerShell script used for converting the output of a headband designed to measure individual’s EEG readings to understandable csv format.
Created a script for emailing research participants using a script tailored to Solaris CLI to ensure that all the participants received a notification email automatically.
Created a program in Java for determing the usefullness of pictures taken by a webcam during each participant’s overnight run in the driving simulator.

work.summary: Responded to internal IT tickets raised and diagnosed issues regarding software and hardware issues with virtual and physical machines.
highlights: Became more familiar with UNIX and Linux operating systems.
Assisted in the migration from NIS to LDAP directory services protocol.
Troubleshooted issues with NIS and LDAP configurations on Linux and UNIX machines.
Created Red Hat and SuSE LDAP enabled templates for vSphere to replace existing NIS templates.
Learned how to create and delete Solaris Zones from scratch and from a standard flar.
Coordinated with HPe, IBM, and Oracle if servers went down and were facing hardware failures.
Assisted in the maintenance outage with involved shutting down the Solaris, Red Hat, SuSE, AIX and HP-UX machines, bring them back up and deal with the software and hardware failures that arised

work.position: Research Assistant for Definition and Measuremnt of Social Competence Study
work.summary: Ran particpants through a study designed to determine the common themes associated with social competence.
highlights: Administered and answered any questions that the students had related to the study.
Tested and supervised up to 6 students at any given time
Created a script for emailing research participants using a script tailored to Solaris CLI to ensure that all the participants received a notification email automatically
Created a program for providing the necessary links implemented using Visual C# and Visual Studio to improve my efficiency during my Research Assistant position

work.summary: Customizes the development and production JIRA environments for individual project and team purposes.
highlights: Learned more Linux commands to be able to navigate the Red Hat Linux environment.
Administered and enhanced the JIRA installation to make it one of the company's most-used IT service desk systems.
Led upgrade process for JIRA environments which involved researching needed steps for upgrading, coordinating with multiple colleagues for setting up and testing the environment.
Created a PowerShell script for automating the process of creating user, activating users and deactivating uses in any specified Salesforce organization
Wrote a manual to allow for inexperienced users to use the SalesForce JIRA project and SalesForce Service Desk project.
Cleaned sales on Postgres Database which required contacting all departments and individual who used sales and customizing the cleaning script to take their sales into account
Created, configured, and maintained Linux virtual machines to for development and QA.
Handled software and hardware inventories and improving the hardware management process to prevent future losses.
Learned how to add, remove and modify users on Windows Active Directory using PowerShell

work.summary: Helped first time students know what they needed to do for their first term in terms of where the offices they needed to go are.
highlights: Assisted first time students on how to register for courses and the way the waitlist worked
Helped students find out how they access their accounts and booklist
Explained to students the options in their booklist based on instruction by their professors

Due to a system error, 3,000+ students were dropped from courses and made our regular method of determining booklists ineffective, was able to find a workaround and teach it to other colleagues to help customers buy the required texts they needed for their courses

work.position: IT, Waiter, Cashier, Stocker, Janitor and Fry-cooker
highlights: Took customer orders while answering any questions they had about the menu
Ensured that customers were always able to find what they needed
Learnt some Portuguese to be able to tend to Brazilian customers
Worked efficiently during the Soccer World Cup rush in the restaurant
Quickly wiped down tables and tended to customers paying their bills to ensure that incoming customers had a place to sit
Would often cater to 4-5 tables at once during hours when I was working alone.

volunteer.summary: Admined multiple servers that were used by the CSSS as well as managing the Github and Google Drive.
highlights: Greatly improved the process for setting up permissions for CSSS Executives on necessary services used by the CSSS
Research and implemented a password management system to replace the old system being used.
